list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She swiped the tennis ball over the net
He swiped at the wasp, but didn’t hit it.
She took a swipe at the ball with her bat.

list_ex_of_english: To strafe, the player swipes left or right on the screen using two fingers.
The team must purchase any two items; the card is swiped into a card reader for each purchase.
The game is controlled using virtual buttons on-screen; a virtual control stick is used for movement, while aiming is achieved by swiping on the touchscreen.
In some elevators, certain floors are inaccessible unless one swipes a security card or enters a passcode (or both).
Passengers enter the subway by swiping farecards to unlock the turnstiles.
The gondola was protected, but most of the logs and charts were swiped by souvenir hunters.
All unused block meal swipes and dining credits are forfeited at the end of each semester.
The new on-screen buttons can be hidden by swiping them to the side of the screen.
